result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J Marsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

*Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment and/or school.
*Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah J Marsh

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant Isaiah J Marsh in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Isaiah J Marsh in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction with credit of 3 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment and/or school.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA, during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Isaiah J Marsh not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Case heard off the record.  Defense requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah J Marsh in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Due to this court being in trial, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah J Marsh in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Case adjourned off the record, form filed. Case set before branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah J Marsh in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Isaiah J Marsh in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Isaiah J Marsh in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
